result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy Ray Brown Jr

records.addlTxt: Request from counsel to reschedule motion hearing to accommodate officers that will be testifying; matter reset to 12/1/2022 at 11:00 am

Defendant Billy Ray Brown Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Billy Ray Brown Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken for Amy Spanczak in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference.  Defense has received global offer from the State and will be filing a Motion to Suppress.  Court sets deadline of 10/19/2022 for filing of motion and deadline of 11/8/2022 for filing of State's response.  Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Motion hearing.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Billy Ray Brown Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Billy Ray Brown Jr.  Attorney Patrick Franken in court on behalf of Amy E Spanczak for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense received discovery and no offer. Defendant has a pending case 22CF2160 that is set for a plea hearing. Court find good cause to adjourn matter for a status with the pending matter for a possibly global resolution. Case remains calendared in Branch 09.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Billy Ray Brown Jr. in custody, appeared by video. Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Billy Ray Brown Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin in person. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #22CF2160. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Ortiz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Billy Ray Brown in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Billy Ray Brown in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Billy Ray Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
